description:
Xapi sessions can disappear or become unusable for a variety of reasons, and need to be recreated. Current code doesn't appear to support this. Ideally it should recreate the session without interrupting ongoing operations or missing out or repeating steps.

Connection should also handle the HOST_IS_SLAVE error.

Revno:446
title: nova-compute will not recover from loss of its xapi session

comments.content:

comments.content:
Hi Thierry, 
I tried to reproduce this failure several times but I have been unsuccessful so far. 
Even if I can provide a patch which automatically tries to recreate the connection if it becomes invalid, I think a good understanding of the failure behaviour will help us implementing a better fix. 
I will decide the best course of action ASAP.

As for the HOST_IS_SLAVE error, I will create a different bug report, as it is a different issue, which occurs if nova-compute connects to a non-master member of a pool. 

Salvatore
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~salvatore-orlando

comments.content:
I have unfortunately been unable to reproduce the failure so far:

It seems the xenapi library is able to reconnect to xapi automatically and restore the session. 
Tests performed:

- Temporarily interrupting transport between nova-compute and xapi daemon
- Stop/Start xapi daemon on server while VM spawn operation in progress
- No operation on session for 24 hours in order to allow it to expire

Unassigning myself, hope somebody else will have more luck.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~salvatore-orlando

comments.content: Might be time to get rid of this bug, it's based on rev 446 and has been unable to be reproduced. Unless someone can provide recent tracebacks, I'll delete the issue and assume that we solved it accidentally along the way.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~blamar

comments.content:
I'm going to close this out. XenAPI will automatically relogin if its session is invalid.

Since no one has seen this problem in almost a year, it's likely not a problem anymore.

If someone sees something related again, open up a new bug please.
